comments:
build N20040309

- start eclipse with no -data
- exit
- get the following in the log


!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Mar 09, 2004 12:39:11.69
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-
in: "org.eclipse.core.runtime".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.DataArea.getStateLocation
(DataArea.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.getStateLocation
(InternalPlatform.java:1054)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Plugin.getStateLocation(Plugin.java:376)
	at

(CheatSheetPlugin.java:192)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.cheatsheets.CheatSheetPlugin.access$1
(CheatSheetPlugin.java:191)

(CheatSheetPlugin.java:258)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run
(InternalPlatform.java:646)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:497)
	at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.cheatsheets.CheatSheetPlugin.saveCheatSheetHistory
(CheatSheetPlugin.java:247)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.cheatsheets.CheatSheetPlugin.shutdown
(CheatSheetPlugin.java:301)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.cheatsheets.CheatSheetPlugin.stop
(CheatSheetPlugin.java:356)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.compatibility.PluginActivator.stop
(PluginActivator.java:67)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContext$2.run
(BundleContext.java:1029)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContext.stop
(BundleContext.java:1025)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleHost.stopWorker
(BundleHost.java:481)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Bundle.stop(Bundle.java:477)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginStopper.run
(PluginStopper.java:99)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator.stopLegacyBundles
(PlatformActivator.java:290)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run
(PlatformActivator.java:272)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:173)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:106)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:305)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:745)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:713)

The NPE happens because the bundle reference in the Plugin instance has already
been cleared, what is done during shutdown.

It seems that the CheatSheet#stop method is calling #shutdown. That is wrong.
Runtime calls #shutdown on a plugin object before calling #stop.

Moving to Update.
Lorne, can you look at this?
*** Bug 54190 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 54220 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
With version v20040309c of cheat sheets, this problem has been fixed. Oops!
